materials.raw_text:
Beryllium oxide (BeO): 20 g 
 Neodymium oxide (Nd2O3): 30 g 
 Silicon dioxide (SiO2): 100 g 
 Samarium oxide (Sm2O3): 15 g

sourcing.instructions: Beryllium oxide can be sourced from chemical supply companies or specialized material suppliers. Neodymium oxide is available through rare earth material suppliers or online marketplaces. Silicon dioxide can be obtained from various chemical suppliers or as a common ingredient in sand. Samarium oxide can be found through rare earth material suppliers or chemical distributors.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 20 g of beryllium oxide, 30 g of neodymium oxide, 100 g of silicon dioxide, and 15 g of samarium oxide using a precision balance. 
 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all the measured powders. 
 3. Use a mortar and pestle or a ball mill to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous blend is achieved.
